A careless admin used weak RSA, choosing both primes as Blum integers. Can you recover the flag from this ciphertext? 9580655886953897094201985262573415907325636832194917448928503845375393608747267203168713275469857584110863731283309671697162832573043073763682320222611802

The flag format is flag{...}
n=12439372321856983595849856418114024838077675543074935401715180694214524875407315408093350137158203196661595815432130652134821427467657661298094971668822749, e=8000874419096810321020312382761001492211606584906090736325428441858494641148885794815181174199429517020087728606966902168364080690728083061264090444770477
The lower 104 bits of p are: 66504537758962856680082214023707147027


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{tcw23vlj}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 9580655886953897094201985262573415907325636832194917448928503845375393608747267203168713275469857584110863731283309671697162832573043073763682320222611802
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=12439372321856983595849856418114024838077675543074935401715180694214524875407315408093350137158203196661595815432130652134821427467657661298094971668822749, e=8000874419096810321020312382761001492211606584906090736325428441858494641148885794815181174199429517020087728606966902168364080690728083061264090444770477
The lower 104 bits of p are: 66504537758962856680082214023707147027

extra_info: p=111032888705908084308828236737372968093169177471345681387129599564483903011603, q=112033222469830976054830725073411180896078438765443610222314374488028025339983, Ï†(n)=12439372321856983595849856418114024838077675543074935401715180694214524875407092341982174398097839537699785031283141404518584638176048217324042459740471164
